ṭhāyin：a．[ṭhāya-in．cf．tiṭṭhati] 在～狀態的（being in a state of ～），處在～的（staying with）．
ṭhāyin：a．[ṭhāya-in．cf．tiṭṭhati] 状態にある，処在せる．

Ṭhāyin，（adj．-n．） [from tiṭṭhati] standing，being in，being in a state of （-°），staying with，dependent on （with Gen．）：pariyuṭṭhaṭṭhāyin “being in a state of one to whom it has arisen，” i．e．one who has got the idea of ．．．or one who imagines S．III，3 sq．； arūpa-ṭṭhāyin It．62； Yamassa ṭhāyino being under the rule of Yama Pv．I，11<sup>9</sup>．（Page 290）
